text: in good to great we wrote a whole
chapter called technology accelerators
and the essential punchline of that
chapter is that those who uh built the
Great companies were not more advanced
in necessarily in their use of
technology and they certainly did not
Embrace every technology that came down
the road the critical question they
asked themselves was does this
technology fit with the three circles
that make us great does it fit with what
we're passionate about does it fit with
what we can be the best in the world at
and does it fit with what Drive our
economic engine and just because
everybody else thinks it's cool and just
because everybody else is doing it
doesn't mean you should the really
critical question is does it fit with
your three circles is it an accelerator
of your three circles now one of the
things that's very interesting when we
go back and we do analysis over
time rarely are those who became great
the leaders in pioneering the
application of Technology they tend to
be ones who sort of learn and see what
actually works for their particular
situation they're somewhat conservative
as one of the great Chief Executives we
recently uh uh been researching put it
we like to be one fad behind right
they're one fad behind but then when
they see that something really does work
then they'll harness it to their
flywheel that's what we've seen seen on
technology
